sen.j: 徳大寺 実祖（とくだいじ さねみ、宝暦3年1月6日 (旧暦)（1753年2月8日） - 文政2年1月28日 (旧暦)（1819年2月22日））は、江戸時代中期から後期の公卿。
sen.e: Sanemi TOKUDAIJI (February 8, 1753 - February 22, 1819) was a Court noble who lived from the middle Edo period to the late Edo period.
Sanemi TOKUDAIJI (February 8, 1753 - February 22, 1819) was Kugyo (a Court Noble) between the middle and late period of Edo.
sen.cmt: 文法整理のため、訂正しました。
sen.e: Sanemi TOKUDAIJI (February 8, 1753 - February 22, 1819) was Kugyo (a Court Noble) between the middle and late period of Edo.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 主に桃園天皇（116代）・後桜町天皇（117代）・後桃園天皇（118代）・光格天皇（119代）の四代にわたって仕えた。
sen.e: He served at the Imperial Court during the reigns of four emperors: Emperor Momozono (the one hundred-sixteenth Japanese emperor), Emperor Gosakuramachi (the one hundred-seventeenth Japanese emperor), Emperor Gomomozono (the one hundred-eighteenth Japanese emperor), and Emperor Kokaku (the one hundred-nineteenth Japanese emperor).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He primarily served for the four sovereigns: the 116th Emperor Momozono, the 117th Emperor Gosakuramachi, the 118th Emperor Gomomozono and the 119th Emperor Kokaku.
sen.cmt: 他の西園寺ファイルとの整合性から、表現を訂正しました。
sen.e: He primarily served for the four sovereigns: the 116th Emperor Momozono, the 117th Emperor Gosakuramachi, the 118th Emperor Gomomozono and the 119th Emperor Kokaku.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 従一位右大臣まで昇った。
sen.e: His final official title was Udaijin (Minister of the Right) with the rank of Juichii (Junior First Rank).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was promoted up to Juichii - Udaijin (Junior First Rank and Minister of the Right).
sen.cmt: 他の西園寺ファイルとの整合性から、表現を訂正しました。
sen.e: He was promoted up to Juichii (Junior First Rank) Udaijin (Minister of the Right).
sen.cmt: 表現を変更しました。

sen.j: 父は内大臣西園寺公晃。
sen.e: His father was Naidaijin (Inner Minister) Kinaki SAIONJI.
His father was Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) Kinaki SAIONJI.
sen.cmt: 内大臣を定訳により訂正しました。
sen.e: His father was Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) Kinaki SAIONJI.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 母は内大臣今出川伊季の娘。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Naidaijin Koresue IMADEGAWA.
His mother was a daughter of Naidaijin Koresue IMADEGAWA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Naidaijin Koresue IMADEGAWA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 養父は大納言徳大寺公城。
sen.e: His adoptive father was Gon Dainagon (provisional chief councilor of state) Kinmura TOKUDAIJI.
sen.cmt: 原文に「大納言」とございますが、リンク先の用語となっているようです。ウェブを確認し、「権大納言」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: His adoptive father was "Gon Dainagon" (Provisional Chief Councilor of State) Kinmura TOKUDAIJI.
sen.cmt: 役職に""を追加し、訳の頭文字を大文字にしました。
sen.e: His adoptive father was Gon Dainagon (Provisional Chief Councilor of State) Kinmura TOKUDAIJI.
sen.cmt: 役職の"を削除しました。

sen.j: 子に大納言徳大寺公迪・中納言清水谷実揖・泰君（広島藩主浅野斉賢継室）がいる。
sen.e: His children were Gon Dainagon Kinmichi TOKUDAIJI, Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) Saneyu SHIMIZUDANI, and Princess Yasu (the second wife of Narikata ASANO, the lord of the Hiroshima Domain).
sen.cmt: 原文に「大納言」とございますが、リンク先の用語となっているようです。ウェブを確認し、「権大納言」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: He had several children including Gon Dainagon Kinmichi TOKUDAIJI, Chunagon (Vice-Councilor of State) Saneyu SHIMIZUDANI and Princess Yasu who was the second wife of the lord of the Hiroshima Domain, Narikata ASANO.
sen.cmt: 他の西園寺ファイルとの整合性から、表現を訂正しました。
sen.e: He had several children including Gon Dainagon Kinmichi TOKUDAIJI, Chunagon (Vice-Councilor of State) Saneyu SHIMIZUDANI and Princess Yasu who was the second wife of the lord of the Hiroshima Domain, Narikata ASANO.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 初めは季繁と名乗った。
sen.e: His original name was Sueshige.
He called himself Sueshige at the beginning.
sen.cmt: 文法整理のため、訂正しました。
sen.e: He called himself Sueshige at the beginning.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 西園寺公晃の二男（三男とも）として京都に生まれた。
sen.e: He was born second son (some people believe he was born third son) to Kinaki SAIONJI in Kyoto.
He was born the second son (some people say he was the third son) to Kinaki SAIONJI in Kyoto.

sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 宝暦7年（1757年）に叙爵。
sen.e: He was conferred a peerage in 1757.
He was conferred a peerage in 1757.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He was conferred a peerage in 1757.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 宝暦10年（1760年）に徳大寺公城に養子に入った。
sen.e: He was adopted by Kinmura TOKUDAIJI in 1760.
He was adopted by Kinmura TOKUDAIJI in 1760.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その後、侍従・近衛府・近衛府を経て、安永2年（1773年）に中納言、安永3年（1774年）に後桜町上皇の院御厩別当となる。
sen.e: After he experienced Ukone no Gon no Shosho (Provisional Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and Sakone no Gon no Chujo (Provisional Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), he was appointed Gon Chunagon (provisional vice-councilor of state) in 1773 and then he became the chief of the In no Miumaya (a division which was responsible for looking after oxen and horses) of the Retired Emperor Gosakuramachi in 1774.
sen.cmt: 原文に「近衛府・近衛府」とございますが、リンク先の用語となっているようです。ウェブを確認し、「右近衛権少将・左近衛権少将」として訳出いたしました。また「中納言」とある個所もリンク先の用語で、「権中納言」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: After he took the positions of "Ukone no Gon no Shosho" (Provisional Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and "Sakone no Gon no Chujo" (Provisional Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), he was appointed "Gon Chunagon" (Provisional Vice-Councilor of State) in 1773; He became the chief of "In no Miumaya" (the division which was responsible for looking after oxen and horses) for the Retired Emperor Gosakuramachi in 1774.
sen.cmt: experienced→took the positions ofに訂正しました。役職に""を追加し、訳の頭文字を大文字にしました。And thenを削除し、;としました。 of the Retired Emperor→for the Retired Emperorとしました。

sen.e: In 1797, he became the Ukone no Daisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), and also he was appointed Umaryo Gogen (Inspector of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses).
sen.cmt: 原文に「近衛府・馬寮」とございますが、リンク先の用語となっているようです。ウェブを確認し、「右近衛大将・右馬寮御監」として訳出いたしました。
